page.title: 14History 2 Upton Snodsbury
page.content:
There is a Saxon Burial Ground at Holy Oak Farm, Upton Snodsbury.This is thought to be the most westerly pagan Saxon burial ground. Pendants found here are in the Worcester city museum. Opposite the entrance to Holy Oak Farm there is an old Saxon road to a settlement near the Coventry Arms public house.
Place names:-
The Piddle Brook = from 'pedalle' or stepping stones. Naunton = new settlement. Upton Snodsbury = upper town Snoddes = name of person Bury = settlement. White Ladies = (nuns) Aston Aston = east town. -
